dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Trump just declared a national emergency for the coronavirus pandemic, freeing up 50 billion dollars in federal aid.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Trump just declared a national emergency for the coronavirus pandemic, freeing up fifty billion dollars in federal aid.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fresh off their worst losses since 1987, U.S. stocks rebounded sharply following President Trumps announcement that the coronavirus pandemic would be declared a national emergency, a move that will free up as much as $50 billion in federal aid to help combat the crisis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the market reacted instantly—the Dow, S&P, and Nasdaq all jumped about 9.1% right as he started speaking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the market reacted instantly-the Dow, S&P, and Nasdaq all jumped about nine point one percent right as he started speaking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the close of markets on Friday, just minutes after President Trump began speaking, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the S&P 500, and the Nasdaq Composite all soared by about 9.3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's one of the sharpest rebounds we've seen after those brutal losses earlier this week. CEOs from Walmart, CVS, uh, Target were all standing with him too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's one of the sharpest rebounds we've seen after those brutal losses earlier this week. CEOs from Walmart, C V S, uh, Target were all standing with him too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CEOs of major U.S. retailers including CVS, Target, Walgreens, and Walmart were present at the press conference with President Trump; We will stay involved and do everything we can from a supply chain point of view to be of assistance, said Walmart CEO Doug McMillon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Doug McMillon from Walmart said they're gonna do everything they can from a supply chain point of view to help out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Doug McMillon from Walmart said they're gonna do everything they can from a supply chain point of view to help out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CEOs of major U.S. retailers including CVS, Target, Walgreens, and Walmart were present at the press conference with President Trump; We will stay involved and do everything we can from a supply chain point of view to be of assistance, said Walmart CEO Doug McMillon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there was the oil move—Trump's directing the Department of Energy to buy crude for the Strategic Reserve.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there was the oil move-Trump's directing the Department of Energy to buy crude for the Strategic Reserve.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump said he will waive interest on student debt, and that he has directed the Department of Energy to buy large quantities of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve; WTI Crude saw a bump from the announcement and ended the day up 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which gave WTI crude a nice little bump, up 4.5% by the end of the day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which gave W T I crude a nice little bump, up four point five percent by the end of the day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump said he will waive interest on student debt, and that he has directed the Department of Energy to buy large quantities of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve; WTI Crude saw a bump from the announcement and ended the day up 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But investors are still waiting on that coronavirus relief bill—Mnuchin and Pelosi both say it's coming soon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But investors are still waiting on that coronavirus relief bill-Mnuchin and Pelosi both say it's coming soon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Investors are still anxiously awaiting a coronavirus relief bill; both Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi have indicated that the bills passage is imminent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Even with today's rally, the Dow's still down like 10% for the week overall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even with today's rally, the Dow's still down like ten percent for the week overall.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%, while the yield on the 10-Year U.S. Treasury bond rose 28% this week to 0.981% and the VIX Index fell back to about 57 from a high of 77.54 earlier this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the VIX, you know, the fear index, it dropped back to around 57 after hitting over 77 this morning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the V I X, you know, the fear index, it dropped back to around fifty seven after hitting over seventy seven this morning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%, while the yield on the 10-Year U.S. Treasury bond rose 28% this week to 0.981% and the VIX Index fell back to about 57 from a high of 77.54 earlier this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, cases in the U.S. keep climbing—over 1,700 infected now, 41 deaths.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, cases in the U.S. keep climbing-over seventeen hundred infected now, forty one deaths.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Confirmed cases of the coronavirus in the United States continued to grow at an alarming rate this week, with more than 1,741 infected and 41 people dead as of Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Companies are shifting to work-from-home, some are even laying people off already, like Norwegian Air.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Companies are shifting to work-from-home, some are even laying people off already, like Norwegian Air.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many companies are implementing mandatory work from policies, and others, like Norwegian Air, are already beginning to lay off workers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But there's a bit of hope—South Korea actually reported more recoveries than new infections today.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But there's a bit of hope-South Korea actually reported more recoveries than new infections today.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Italy remains on lockdown, while South Korea reported more recoveries from the virus than new infections for the first time since the outbreak began in January.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh and Microsoft jumped 9% after Trump praised their new coronavirus testing website.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh and Microsoft jumped nine percent after Trump praised their new coronavirus testing website.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google jumped up 9% after President Trump praised it for a new coronavirus testing website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And don't forget the oil price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia—Saudi's planning to pump 12.3 million barrels a day now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And don't forget the oil price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia-Saudi's planning to pump twelve point three million barrels a day now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Saudi Arabia said it will ramp up production to a record 12.3 million barrels per day, and the United Arab Emirates followed suit, promising to boost its own capacity to 5 million barrels per day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, which is why oil's been so volatile. But Lindsey Bell from Ally Invest had a good quote—bear markets are unnerving, but stocks always recover.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, which is why oil's been so volatile. But Lindsey Bell from Ally Invest had a good quote-bear markets are unnerving, but stocks always recover.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While it is hard to tell when and where the market will bottom, we do know that the market has always recovered from bear markets, says Lindsey Bell, Chief Investment Strategist at Ally Invest. Bear markets are unnerving, but history shows stocks eventually recover.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Even if it takes eight months on average to bounce back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even if it takes eight months on average to bounce back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, it may take a while to get back to new highs the S&P 500 has taken an average of eight months to recoup losses in all bear markets since 1946.
